object.attribute:
Nuki is made with Cocoa, Nu, NuMarkdown, NuHTTP and a little work.
A debt of thanks goes to Tim Burks for creating such a great language and toolset.

Welcome to Nuki!
This is a live-Nu wiki created by Patrick Thomson and released on January 6, 2008. There's a lot more that can be done to it, but see what he's done so far!
You can read Patrick's original announcement on the [Nu mailing list](http://groups.google.com/group/programming-nu/browse_thread/thread/96f78e4f7833cb1d#c768040c27b9f076).
Nuki uses Grayson Hansard's NuMarkdown package for text formatting, NuHTTP to serve pages, CoreData to store them, and it's entirely written in Nu.
[How to Nuki](/HowToNuki).

Just click the edit button to edit a page.
Links are done with Markdown syntax: [AboutNuki](/AboutNuki)
When you follow a link to a nonexistent page, you'll have the option to create it.
Normal HTML is escaped: \u3c00b\u3e00 \u3c00/b\u3e00
